API Reference

This section provides a detailed reference of all modules, classes, and functions in the PyQt Live Tuner library.

Core Components

ApplicationBuilder

class pyqt_live_tuner.ApplicationBuilder(title='My Application')

A builder class that provides a clean interface for creating and running PyQt Live Tuner applications.

Parameters:

title (str) – The title for the application window (default: “My Application”)

main_window

The main application window instance (pyqt_live_tuner.MainApplication).

run()

Build the main window and launch the application. This method blocks until the application is closed.

Returns:

None

MainApplication

class pyqt_live_tuner.MainApplication(title='My Application')

The main window class for PyQt Live Tuner applications. It manages parameter containers and provides menu options for saving and loading configurations.

Parameters:

title (str) – The title for the window (default: “My Application”)

set_parameters_container(container, name='Parameters')

Sets the parameters container for the application.

Parameters:

  • container (ParametersContainer) – The container to set

  • name (str) – The label to display above the container

Returns:

None

set_configurations_container(container, name='Configurations')

Sets the configurations container for the application.

Parameters:

  • container (ConfigurationsContainer) – The container to set

  • name (str) – The label to display above the container

Returns:

None

add_parameter(param)

Adds a parameter widget to the parameters container, creating the container if it doesn’t exist.

Parameters:

param (ParameterWidget) – The parameter widget to add

Returns:

None

add_parameter_group(group)

Adds a parameter group to the parameters container, creating the container if it doesn’t exist.

Parameters:

group (ParameterGroupWidget) – The parameter group to add

Returns:

None

add_configuration_widget(widget, label=None)

Adds a widget to the configurations container, creating the container if it doesn’t exist.

Parameters:

  • widget (QWidget) – The widget to add

  • label (str) – Optional label to display above the widget

Returns:

None

Container Components

ParametersContainer

class pyqt_live_tuner.containers.ParametersContainer(parent=None)

A scrollable container for organizing parameter widgets and groups. Supports reading and applying values from JSON.

Parameters:

parent (QWidget) – The parent widget

add_param(widget)

Adds a parameter widget to the container.

Parameters:

widget (ParameterWidget) – The parameter widget to add

Returns:

None

add_group(group)

Adds a parameter group to the container.

Parameters:

group (ParameterGroupWidget) – The parameter group to add

Returns:

None

get_values()

Returns the current values of all parameters and groups.

Returns:

A dictionary of parameter values

Return type:

dict

set_values(values)

Sets the values of parameters and groups based on the provided dictionary.

Parameters:

values (dict) – A dictionary of parameter values

Returns:

None

ConfigurationsContainer

class pyqt_live_tuner.containers.ConfigurationsContainer(parent=None)

A container for configuration widgets such as plots, image displays, or other custom widgets.

Parameters:

parent (QWidget) – The parent widget

Parameter Widgets

ParameterWidget (Base Class)

class pyqt_live_tuner.parameter_widgets.ParameterWidget(name='Unnamed', config=None)

The base class for all parameter widgets. Implements common functionality and defines the interface that all parameter widgets must follow.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the parameter

  • config (dict) – A configuration dictionary for the widget

valueChanged

A PyQt signal that is emitted when the parameter value changes.

Signal signature: valueChanged(name: str, value: Any)

get_value()

Returns the current value of the parameter. Must be implemented by subclasses.

Returns:

The current parameter value

Return type:

Any

set_value(value)

Sets the value of the parameter. Must be implemented by subclasses.

Parameters:

value (Any) – The new parameter value

Returns:

None

register_callback(callback)

Registers a function to be called when the parameter value changes.

Parameters:

callback (callable) – A function that takes (name, value) arguments

Returns:

None

FloatParameterWidget

class pyqt_live_tuner.parameter_widgets.FloatParameterWidget(name='Unnamed', config=None)

A parameter widget for adjusting floating-point values using a slider or spin box.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the parameter

  • config (dict) –

    Configuration dictionary with the following optional keys:

    • min (float): Minimum value (default: 0.0)

    • max (float): Maximum value (default: 10.0)

    • step (float): Step size (default: 0.1)

    • initial (float): Initial value (default: min)

    • precision (int): Decimal precision (default: 2)

set_value(value)

Sets the current value of the parameter.

Parameters:

value (float) – The new parameter value

Returns:

None

get_value()

Returns the current value of the parameter.

Returns:

The current parameter value

Return type:

float

BoolParameterWidget

class pyqt_live_tuner.parameter_widgets.BoolParameterWidget(name='Unnamed', config=None)

A parameter widget for boolean values using a checkbox.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the parameter

  • config (dict) –

    Configuration dictionary with the following optional keys:

    • initial (bool): Initial state (default: False)

set_value(value)

Sets the current state of the checkbox.

Parameters:

value (bool) – The new parameter state

Returns:

None

get_value()

Returns the current state of the checkbox.

Returns:

The current checkbox state

Return type:

bool

DropdownParameterWidget

class pyqt_live_tuner.parameter_widgets.DropdownParameterWidget(name='Unnamed', config=None)

A parameter widget for selecting from a list using a dropdown.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the parameter

  • config (dict) –

    Configuration dictionary with the following optional keys:

    • options (list): List of options (default: [])

    • initial (str): Initial selection (default: first option)

    • placeholder (str): Placeholder text (default: “Select an option”)

set_value(value)

Sets the current selection.

Parameters:

value (str) – The new selection

Returns:

None

get_value()

Returns the current selection.

Returns:

The current selection

Return type:

str

update_options(options, initial=None)

Updates the available options in the dropdown.

Parameters:

  • options (list) – The new list of options

  • initial (str) – The new initial selection (optional)

Returns:

None

StringParameterWidget

class pyqt_live_tuner.parameter_widgets.StringParameterWidget(name='Unnamed', config=None)

A parameter widget for entering text using a line edit.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the parameter

  • config (dict) –

    Configuration dictionary with the following optional keys:

    • initial (str): Initial text (default: “”)

    • placeholder (str): Placeholder text (default: “”)

set_value(value)

Sets the current text.

Parameters:

value (str) – The new text

Returns:

None

get_value()

Returns the current text.

Returns:

The current text

Return type:

str

ActionParameterWidget

class pyqt_live_tuner.parameter_widgets.ActionParameterWidget(name='Unnamed', config=None)

A parameter widget for triggering actions using a button.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the parameter (button text)

  • config (dict) –

    Configuration dictionary with the following optional keys:

    • callback (callable): Function to call when button is clicked

set_value(value)

This method is a no-op for action widgets since they don’t have a persistent value.

Parameters:

value (Any) – Ignored

Returns:

None

get_value()

Returns None since action widgets don’t have a persistent value.

Returns:

None

Parameter Groups

ParameterGroupWidget (Base Class)

class pyqt_live_tuner.parameter_groups.ParameterGroupWidget(title='Unnamed Group', parent=None)

The base class for all parameter groups. Implements common functionality for organizing and managing related parameters.

Parameters:

  • title (str) – The title of the group

  • parent (QWidget) – The parent widget

title()

Returns the title of the group.

Returns:

The group title

Return type:

str

add_parameter(widget)

Adds a parameter widget to the group.

Parameters:

widget (ParameterWidget) – The parameter widget to add

Returns:

None

get_values()

Returns the current values of all parameters in the group.

Returns:

A dictionary of parameter values

Return type:

dict

set_values(values)

Sets the values of parameters in the group based on the provided dictionary.

Parameters:

values (dict) – A dictionary of parameter values

Returns:

None

LinkedParameterGroup

class pyqt_live_tuner.parameter_groups.LinkedParameterGroup(title='Unnamed Group', parent=None)

A group of related parameters that emits a signal with all parameter values when any parameter changes.

Parameters:

  • title (str) – The title of the group

  • parent (QWidget) – The parent widget

groupChanged

A PyQt signal that is emitted when any parameter in the group changes.

Signal signature: groupChanged(group_name: str, values: dict)

add_parameter(widget)

Adds a parameter widget to the group and connects its valueChanged signal.

Parameters:

widget (ParameterWidget) – The parameter widget to add

Returns:

None

register_callback(callback)

Registers a function to be called when any parameter in the group changes.

Parameters:

callback (callable) – A function that takes (group_name, values_dict) arguments

Returns:

None

IndependentGroupWidget

class pyqt_live_tuner.parameter_groups.IndependentGroupWidget(title='Unnamed Group', parent=None)

A group of parameters that are visually grouped but don’t emit a combined signal. Each parameter emits its own independent signals.

Parameters:

  • title (str) – The title of the group

  • parent (QWidget) – The parent widget

add_parameter(widget)

Adds a parameter widget to the group without connecting signals.

Parameters:

widget (ParameterWidget) – The parameter widget to add

Returns:

None

Utility Classes

Logger

pyqt_live_tuner.logger

A logging utility for debugging and tracing. Uses Python’s built-in logging module.
